meanings.definition: One of a series of similar body segments in an animal
meanings.sent1: The worm's body is made up of several metameres.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar's metamere allows it to move in a coordinated manner.
meanings.sent3: The metamere of the snake seemed to dance as it slithered along.
meanings.sent4: Each metamere of the centipede was like a tiny puzzle piece in its long body.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied the metamere of the insect under a microscope.

meanings.definition: To divide into segments or parts
meanings.sent1: She decided to metamere the project into smaller tasks for easier management.
meanings.sent2: The chef will metamere the recipe into simple steps for the cooking class.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to metamere the scarf into multiple pieces during the trick.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes metamere the canvas into a beautiful landscape.
